Articles.Content:
Fixed that for you - EVE has no role in making the sun white, that's entirely down to replacing the assets file in KSP_Data.

No, it does. EVE uses IIRC 3 layers, The sun texture, and 2 layers for the glow.
I stand corrected then, I didn't know you'd put clouds on the sun
I have skimmed back pretty far so I apologize if this question has been asked and answered but I am sure it has. I have no clouds or auroras what do I do?

I have skimmed back pretty far so I apologize if this question has been asked and answered but I am sure it has. I have no clouds or auroras what do I do?

I kinda need more information than just they don't work.

I kinda need more information than just they don't work.

Im sorry I really don't know what else to say. I installed everything, everything works, it looks wonderful, the only exception is that clouds and auroras dont render at all. The city lights work but no clouds or aurora. These are the mods I am running. There is a slight lag when time warping in orbit but it seems that everyone is reporting that.

Im sorry I really don't know what else to say. I installed everything, everything works, it looks wonderful, the only exception is that clouds and auroras dont render at all. The city lights work but no clouds or aurora. These are the mods I am running. There is a slight lag when time warping in orbit but it seems that everyone is reporting that.

What resolution are you using?

What resolution are you using?

I am using Medium Resolution

I am using Medium Resolution

By clouds you mean the volumetric clouds, not the 2d clouds, right?

By clouds you mean the volumetric clouds, not the 2d clouds, right?

Please forgive the ignorance in my answer, but I have no clouds at all and no Aurora. The planet looks beautiful and clear. How squad should make Kerbin look, but no clouds. This is my first attempt at this so I am sorry. However I installed the low resolution pack and it worked. I looked at all the files in between the two and in the Medium Res pack in BoulderCo the cloudsBetteratmospheres.cfg is missing and its in the low resolution pack. I am going to try that now by adding the missing .cfg. But the Low Res version works. I don't like it especially after seeing the medium resolution.

Please forgive the ignorance in my answer, but I have no clouds at all and no Aurora. The planet looks beautiful and clear. How squad should make Kerbin look, but no clouds. This is my first attempt at this so I am sorry. However I installed the low resolution pack and it worked. I looked at all the files in between the two and in the Medium Res pack in BoulderCo the cloudsBetteratmospheres.cfg is missing and its in the low resolution pack. I am going to try that now by adding the missing .cfg. But the Low Res version works. I don't like it especially after seeing the medium resolution.

Yes, that should fix it. Apparently the download needs to be updated for the Mediafire link.
.24 can't come sooner, this looks so amazing I just hope that .24 doesn't break my save as I have quite a few mods.
0.24 just came out, so I hope to the kraken that this still works!
Does it work with 0.24?

Seems to. I've got v5 installed on a fresh KSP Install with all the dependencies. It told me that RSS wasn't compatible when I loaded the game, but no adverse effects.

e: Yup, Jool's rings are working as intended (inclined), asteroids in the rings.

Seems to. I've got v5 installed on a fresh KSP Install with all the dependencies. It told me that RSS wasn't compatible when I loaded the game, but no adverse effects.

e: Yup, Jool's rings are working as intended (inclined), asteroids in the rings.

I have to reinstall betteratmospheres 5. My gorgeous sun is back to normal.
And everything works fine in .24?

And everything works fine in .24?

It should work.
I get an incompatibility warning with RSS? Everything works though.
I don't use RSS so I'll give it a go.

I get an incompatibility warning with RSS? Everything works though.

RSS's AFG, PQS, and orbiter changers work, however it does not save scaled space textures and makes planets spaz out if you rotate the camera too fast.

I don't use RSS so I'll give it a go.

I thought the RSS plugin was required for this. Its in the mod file.

RSS's AFG, PQS, and orbiter changers work, however it does not save scaled space textures and makes planets spaz out if you rotate the camera too fast.

So if I take RSS out of the folder it, will be ok?

So if I take RSS out of the folder it, will be ok?

Yes.

Keep in mind, nothing here is a dependency for the mod to work. If you don't want, or have a fear of breaking your game with a mod, don't install that section of the mod. RSS only gets rid of the White in the atmosphere.

Yes.

Keep in mind, nothing here is a dependency for the mod to work. If you don't want, or have a fear of breaking your game with a mod, don't install that section of the mod. RSS only gets rid of the White in the atmosphere.

Ahhhh ok good to know.
Not sure if anyone else has this problem, but my Kerbin clouds in map view seem to be doubled. Like there are two layers, slightly apart from each other.
